Description: Spout, handle, and shoulder sherd of Nile Silt pottery trefoil-mouthed oinochoe; exterior: cream slip; narrow black (fired red) band on edge of spout; single wavy band around neck followed by single band on ridged junction of neck and shoulder; horizontal stroked on flat handle; single band below handle root; inscription on handle.
Curator's comments: The sherd was analysed with NAA by H. Mommsen (Bonn), (see Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006, p. 55, Table 1): Sample Nauk 81, Group QANN (Egypt). The shape of the vessel follows that produced in East Greek workshops.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 63, no. 37)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.08)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 173, Nau 142, pl. 31c-d)
